rules: Rule1: If a quarterly security audit is scheduled, then access review is required for all employees.
Rule2: If access review is required for all employees, then when normal operations do not continue during the main shift, the employee receives temporary suspension.
Rule3: If a device compliance check is performed on the employee device or normal operations continue during the main shift, then both conditions cannot be false simultaneously.
Rule4: If software is updated on the employee device, then the employee device is certified.
Rule5: If the employee is authorized for the server room, then the employee does not have access to the server room.

Rule6: If the security system initiates a compliance scan, then when it is not the case that a device compliance check being performed on the employee device leads to software being updated on the employee device, quarantine is required for the employee device.
Rule7: If the security system initiates a compliance scan or manual check is required by the security team, then both conditions cannot be false simultaneously.

Rule8: If manual check is required by the security team, then when it is not the case that a device compliance check being performed on the employee device leads to software being updated on the employee device, quarantine is required for the employee device.
Rule9: If new access control policy is implemented, then security protocols training is updated.
Rule10: If new access control policy is implemented or policy exception is granted to the employee, then both conditions cannot be false simultaneously.
Rule11: If policy exception is granted to the employee, then if the employee has the job role of system administrator, the employee completed security protocols training.
Rule12: If recertification is required for all employees, then if the employee has the job role of system administrator, the employee completed security protocols training.
Rule13: If regulatory change is announced by the compliance board, then if security protocols training is updated, recertification is required for all employees.
Rule14: If regulatory change is announced by the compliance board or internal audit finding is reported, then both conditions cannot be false simultaneously.
Rule15: If internal audit finding is reported, then if security protocols training is updated, recertification is required for all employees.
Rule16: If special project is approved by management, then access is granted to the employee for confidential files.
Rule17: If emergency access is granted to the employee, then normal operations continue during the main shift.
Rule18: If management override is authorized by the director, then special project is approved by management or emergency access is granted to the employee.
Rule19: If the employee completed security protocols training, then the employee is authorized for the server room.
Rule20: If the employee passed the background check, then if the employee has the job role of system administrator, the employee completed security protocols training.
Rule21: If the employee device is registered on the network, then the employee device is authenticated on the network.

Rule22: If it is not the case that access is granted to the employee for confidential files or normal operations continue during the main shift, then access is denied to the employee for confidential files.

Rule23: If it is not the case that a device compliance check being performed on the employee device leads to software being updated on the employee device, then quarantine is not required for the employee device.

Rule24: If it is not the case that automated compliance system is active or a device compliance check being performed on the employee device leads to the employee device being certified, then manual intervention is required by security staff.

Rule25: If it is not the case that the employee device being authenticated on the network leads to normal operations continuing during the main shift, then the security team activates incident response.
Rule26: If it is not the case that the security team activating incident response leads to a security breach being detected on the network, then the security system identifies a false alarm.
Rule27: If it is not the case that the security team activating incident response leads to a security breach being detected on the network, then the security system does not identify a false alarm.
Rule28: If normal operations do not continue during the main shift, then the employee has access to the server room.
Rule29: If normal operations do not continue during the main shift, then the employee does not receive temporary suspension.
facts: Fact1: A quarterly security audit is scheduled.
Fact2: The employee has the job role of system administrator.
Fact3: Management override is authorized by the director.
Fact4: The employee passed the background check.
Fact5: The employee device is registered on the network.
Fact6: Access is not granted to the employee for confidential files.
Fact7: Access is not denied to the employee for confidential files.
Fact8: The employee device is not certified.
Fact9: Automated compliance system is not active.
Fact10: Manual intervention is not required by security staff.
Fact11: A security breach is not detected on the network.

question: Normal operations continue during the main shift.
